body.name: The Irish Nanny: An absolutely heart-wrenching Irish WW2 story
body.description: ‘We have to go, Miss. We can’t wait any longer.’ I hold the baby tighter as the lifeboat is lowered slowly into the water, hitting the rough sea with a splash. My eyes never leave the ship, searching, hoping to see the others and know they are safe…London 1940. As the war rages in Europe, Rose Brown steps on board a ship bound for America, hoping to escape the danger. She’s frightened, but her widowed mammy and three sisters in Ireland need the money she earns as nanny to the rich Townsend family. But while Rose plays with baby Sarah in the salty spray on deck, disaster strikes, and the ocean liner begins to sink. In the chaos, Rose and the baby are separated from the family.Pulled from the sea with the child still in her arms, Rose is afraid as never before. And when she arrives in Brooklyn to search for Sarah’s family she feels completely adrift in this unfamiliar land where looming Brownstones line the streets, and workmen in flat caps jostle her on the sidewalks. But just when Sarah’s father is within reach, the howling air-raid sirens and deafening bombs she thought she’d left behind shatter her plans once again as tragic news arrives from Pearl Harbor.As fear and panic grips America, what heartbreaking sacrifices will Rose have to make to protect her precious charge? And can she reunite the family before it is too late?An emotional, heart-wrenching story of love and family set across Ireland and America during the Second World War. Perfect for fans of Jean Grainger, Lisa Wingate and Diney Costeloe.Readers love The Irish Nanny:‘I loved this book – I lost my whole day reading – just couldn’t bear to put it down!’ Goodreads reviewer‘Outstanding!… It gripped me from the first page until the last!… When a book makes your heart break it deserves all the stars.’ Goodreads reviewer, 5 stars‘Beautiful, harrowing, heart-warming, and heartbreaking all at the same time… 5/5 stars.’ Goodreads reviewer, 5 stars‘A heartbreaking story of WWII. Loved it so much!’Goodreads reviewer, 5 stars‘5 stars… Heartbreaking.’ Goodreads reviewer, 5 stars‘I fell in love… Such an emotionally raw story can only be written by someone who has left a little piece of their heart behind in such a special place.’ Goodreads reviewer

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars The Characters Came to life!
reviews.reviewText: The story was beautiful, and Ms. Taylor brought the characters to life! I felt like I was there with Rose every step of the way. Would love to see a Book 2 come out.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 7, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I loved how Rose's love came full circle. The way. Ms. Taylor weaves the love, fear, angst, and joy together in such a way that it is impossible not to laugh or cry with the characters.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 27, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Keeps you reading
reviews.reviewText: Such a great story. I couldn't stop reading until the end. Must read for a good story and happy ending.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 29, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Loved this Book!
reviews.reviewText: I couldn’t put this book down. The characters were different and I loved each one. I loved the story and adventures. The true friendships.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 25, 2023
reviews.reviewText: A little slow and lacked resolution. I liked the main character but I wanted more depth in her character. A good read for a preteen.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 16, 2022
reviews.reviewText: I have been reading a lot of WWII historical fiction books lately and I found this one to be very well-written but a little too perfect. I honestly can't believe that a girl would recognize the love she had for her little Irish town and never want for anything else. I'd love to have read more about her friend Polly, who desperately wanted to see more of the world. I am going to believe that Rose sends Polly on a magnificent honeymoon and provides marvelous experiences for the newlyweds. Posh hotels and swanky cars!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 25, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I love this story of overcoming challenges and personal growth. Some romance but it was not the main focus. Rose is experiencing life, friendship and family as her adventures take her to Ireland, London and America. Humor and realistic struggles unfold as you connect to the characters in Rose's life. Clean and wholesome. Left me satisfied at the ending and uplifted by the story.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 21, 2023
reviews.reviewText: This is the tale of a young Irish teenage girl that leaves home at the age of 14 to work and help her widowed mother and 3 little sisters. It's a wonderful story. There is love and heartache as well as laughter, joy, and pain as we follow her through WW II; and from a small Irish village, to Cork, to London, to Brooklyn and back to her home from which she began.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on July 8, 2023
reviews.reviewText: For me this book was a page turner. Rose and Polly were best friends who wanted different things in life. Rose never wanted to leave Ballykillen, a small country village on the coast of Ireland, with a river running through it, while Polly dreamt of bigger and better things away from the village. When the girls had left school Polly got them both a job as Chamberlain in a big hotel in Cork, which was less than 20 miles from home but felt it was the start of a new life for them. A guest at hotel struck up a conversation with Rose eventually leading to fer going to England to 'look after his wife,Alice and son Raffi. War came and Rose found herself sailing to the USA, with Alice, Raffi and new baby Sarah, Rose and Sarah being the only two to survive that journey. Find out what happens to Rose before it comes to a happy ending. I recommend reading this book for all who like to have a happy ending.
A gentle holiday read , beautiful evocation of Ireland back in the 40’s and a young girls dreams and adventures
Such a beautiful story. This book is a total page turner and one that I kept reading until finishedLove the emotions and the reality.
